Description: Ostracon (?), large section of a red pottery bowl with circular foot, flaring base, slightly flaring sides and everted ledge-rim, the fabric is pink and grey in section, the outer surface is covered with a burnished red slip and the inside of the rim is painted black with white circles, there is a line of incised Coptic text around the exterior.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell & J. Faiers
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394291) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394291)
